website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive and incredibly solid wooden balance board suitable for all abilities.
pros: Features a textured surface and durable wooden construction
Strong enough to support up to 500 pounds without bending or bowing
cons: A few reviewers found board too easy to work with after a while

customer_reviews.title: Great for home physio use!
customer_reviews.text: The size of the board is good for someone with larger feet 12+. It appears to be made with quality plywood. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the plastic base of the board is very slippery and slides around too much on carpet. You need a rubber mat or something with grip to use it on.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Absolute best of its kind!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute best product for foot/ankle physical therapy or rehabilitation. Very sturdy. I like the ratio of bottom toggle to top pad so much better than others I’ve used. The grip on top is helpful, but not at all painful on the foot & does not flake off. Such a good product!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Heeres

customer_reviews.title: Great quality balance board
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my standing desk at work, and love it. Doesn't leave plastic pieces on the floor like other boards I've used. Easy with your feet close together, challenging with them spread further apart, so I can vary how difficult it is to balance. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 52 year old female. My chiropractor recommended this for me, since I've recently hurt my back. He's trying to build my core and balance. This board accomplishes both. It's also strengthening my ankles and thighs. Added bonus, I guess. The board is easier to work on carpet than on flooring. I switch between the two. I'm hoping to build up some time having the board not touching the ground. I'm happy I have it and grateful for the lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Pafarn J

customer_reviews.title: Adding balance helps
customer_reviews.text: This little balance board works great, I have been using it daily and notice my strength improving, I like to balance while I cook for an added challenge. I believe this works as well as other costly balance items, it is not too difficult and is easy to get used to. I may look for more difficult balance items in the future though this is working find and still offers a challenge. it is a great way to supplement my work outs.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good board
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, sturdy board and I like the color (call me silly, but I like my workout gear to have some color!). The wood doesn't feel quite as smooth as I thought it should be, and picky-me, but the color circle is off-center, which bugs me a lot. But it's not a deal breaker and it doesn't affect my use at all. For the price, I can't really argue too much about the quality. It's a good board.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know how bad my balance was!
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all- I thought this would be a fun tool to add to my home gym. I didn't realize how bad my balance was- I dance all the time! After even 2 weeks I saw huge improvements to my balance. I couldn't stand on it with two feet for more than a few seconds. I'm now doing one leg half squats. I do wish it was silicone and not rough grip on the top. I have to wear a pair of light shoes (I wear my Toms) to work out. Socks or slippers are not good since they don't provide grip and slide off my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great for tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: It does the job that larger balance boards do, yet storage (or hiding in a corner) is much easier. Note, however, that it works better on a hard floor than it does on carpet. On soft surfaces it doesn't have much wobble. This is probably an issue with most competing products also.
customer_reviews.author: kerry knight

customer_reviews.title: Just like my training gym!
customer_reviews.text: We used this at a training gym and it really intensified the work out so I figured I would get one for my home gym. Found this one at such a great price and i love it. Works great, exactly as designed and really gives that double whammy to your work out. Squats and push-ups with it are my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great for regaining balance
customer_reviews.text: I had balance issues . Was sent to physical rehab. The wobble board ( similar to the one I ordered ) , which I used every day of my rehab along with the exercises the therapist prescribed , proved to be exactly what was needed to regain the balance . The tech suggested I get a board for home , showed me one on Amazon . I ordered it and it has proven to be a great ankle strengthener . Do not have to use my cane anymore . Can walk a straight line . I would recommend it to anyone .
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne A. Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts a few uses before the base develops flat regions that make balancing very jerky.
customer_reviews.text: I can't complain about the price. I buy a lot of Amazon brand items and very often they are good enough. This product is not. I purchased this board just to see if these types of balancing exercises would be useful for me. After only a few uses on a wood floor, the rounded bottom of the board has morphed into maybe 6-8 flat radial regions based on the supports underneath the surface plastic. So, instead of smoothly balancing and shifting weight, this has turned into a jerky wobble from one flat spot to another along the rounded part of the board. I'm going to purchase a higher quality board now.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great for foot/ankle exercises after breaks or sprains
customer_reviews.text: I dithered about in getting an Amazon Basics version of this rather than some official physical therapy version and I'm bummed I waited so long. This device is sturdy, seems to be well made, and it is allowing me to do the exercises I need to do. It is on the smaller size as many other reviewers say but I'm using it for foot/ankle exercises so it works just fine. And for a price point of $22 I can afford it. I don't know why I waited so long - probably because I read the negative reviews and I was trying to find the best "does everything" device.
customer_reviews.author: Nifty

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt do as much as I thought
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this balance board would do more. It's actually fairly easy to balance it. Doing leg lifts or other leg exercises would be crazy hard. I can do mini-squats but that's about it. I don't think I would buy it again. It is sturdy and well made. I guess it depends what you want to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chief TB

customer_reviews.title: Simple Approach to Improve Core Balancing Muscles
customer_reviews.text: Very simple and sturdy balancing device at a great price. This is just what I needed for the balancing exercises the physical therapist prescribed for me to strengthen my leg to better support my knee. It is also great to work with my core muscles. Very important to improve balance as we age to reduce injuries from falling. Be sure to use where you have support within easy reach to catch yourself when you loose your balance.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Could be improved
customer_reviews.text: I found it difficult to balance. What I did was sand it down to my ability (picture). I did sand it down a little too much. The balance point is attached with 8 screws. If the manufacturer were to offer maybe 3 different attachments for different abilities, that would allow for growth in ability.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Faircrest

customer_reviews.title: Great product to use with Stand Up Desk
customer_reviews.text: Really love having this to use with my stand up desk. Standing gets a little boring and it's great to feel like you are doing a little more to help yourself. I pull it out when working often and have gotten to a point where I don't touch the desk often to balance myself. Coworkers borrow it and one bought her own. Well built and sturdy too. Only complain would be after a while my feet will hurt. I have bad feet anyway and I think it's because it is a flat, hard surface. But, not an impediment to pulling it out and using it for periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: bz gardner

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself for my birthday. I’ve been wanting one forever, and this is a great deal! This is definitely high quality and sturdy, but it is small. I want it for balance, but I was also hoping to do squats on it eventually. My legs actually touch, so squatting would be awkward. I’m going to keep it, as it works a ton of muscles and I think it will be great for my kiddo, but I’d like to find one that’s more like 20”-25” for me.
customer_reviews.author: BjPace

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Sturdy, and a Good Challenge for those who are Looking for Balance.
customer_reviews.text: I was suprised at first that it looked smaller than I anticipated. It’s about 20” across but even so, it still was a good challenge to work on my balance. The bottom rubber round foot is well rounded so you will be wobbling at first and the stand is made of wood with a sandpaper film on top to give you a grip. The sandpaper film is covering the entire top so you have a wide area to stand upon. However, be careful on accidentally bumping your balance board on anything as the side pieces of wood did chip off. Other than that, it’s a perfect deal for a balance board.
customer_reviews.author: Ex Avier

customer_reviews.title: Ad lies it does not support 500lbs!!
customer_reviews.text: I actually wrote another reveiw that included pictures of the manual. That got denied because the "pictures didn't pertain to the product". Apparently a picture of the products own manual doesn't count. BEWARE IT DOES NOT SUPPORT 500 LBS!!!!!! Per the manual it only supports a maximum weight of 265lbs. Do not order if you weigh more than 265. The name brand supports 350lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Nicci

customer_reviews.title: Solid wobble board, kinda small
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wabble board to assist with my skateboarding. Helps keep my balance strong and strengthen my ankles. My only gripe is that as a 6ft dude the deck is too small. For me to stand shoulder width apart I have to hang off the edges. I'm not that broad shouldered so bigger people beware. Pro's +Low price +Good grip tape +Solid build Cons - deck kinda small for bigger people
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Building my core muscles and increasing my balance skills
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a lot harder than I was expecting but that is good because it gives me a workout and I can really tell that it is building my core and obviously I needed to do a lot of work on my balance... A LOT. It makes me feel good to know that I'm working on my balance now that I'm getting older and unfortunately there's that pesky fear of falling and breaking a hip or ending up on one of those I fallen and can't get up commercials.
customer_reviews.author: PAMALUCHI

customer_reviews.title: Works, helps strengthen my core and it's a great value
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Bosu ball to strengthen my core and help with sciatic pain - with GREAT success! Some people with whom I work use this at their standing desk, so I bought one to use at work, too, and it's been awesome. I cycle between standing on my left, then right and then both feet and alternating throughout the day. It's really cheap, especially relative to the Bosu which is very expensive, and it definitely works.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Great wobble board for long-term use
customer_reviews.text: I bought two, one for me and one for my husband to stand while working on our computers. We use it for hours on end with no issues. Having a plastic bottom concerned me in the beginning, but when I used a wooden or MDF-bottomed board, they started to wear out on the carpet...I see no problems with that at all. We also use them during our workouts for added instability training and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Beth B

customer_reviews.title: Helps me stand up more at my desk
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this balance board. I'd never used one before. It was easy to get the hang of it. I don't know if it's actually strengthening my core- I haven't had it that long anyway- but it makes standing at my desk a lot more comfortable and that makes it 100% worth the price. Now when I stand at my desk I'm not constantly shifting my weight from hip to hip and standing weirdly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helped with physical therapy practices at home
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy with this product. My son had a sport injury and the physical therapist recommended one of these balance boards. My son has recovered and now we both use this to build strength and mobility in ankles. I wear a size 6 in women and my son is a 9.5 in men’s so there is plenty of space to have our feet positioned on the board.
customer_reviews.author: Mayda Valverde

customer_reviews.title: Recovering from Sprained Ankle
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to help me recovered from a sprained ankle. I used it for about 15min, 3-4 times for about a month starting 2 weeks after my sprain. Initially I held balance with both feet and then slowly I started using my injured ankle. I was barely able to hold balance for a few seconds at first, but then I slowly regained strength and balance and can now do a one foot stand for several minutes. This is a great recovery tool, may not be challenging enough for someone who is looking for a more challengine exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for my surgery rehab
customer_reviews.text: I had a midfoot fusion surgery. After 5 months my foot had very little strength and I was still in a lot of pain most days. I got this to use in the office. Not only has it helped my foot, but my coworkers love using it to. It's also really helped my balance for paddle boarding. It's simple, well built, and a great price. I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Andrus

customer_reviews.title: Works ok but the price makes it worth trying.
customer_reviews.text: The bottom pieces is more square than round so it doesn’t rotate well when doing ankle exercises. A ball on the bottom would be much easier to work with than what appears to be the shape of a pvc pipe fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Wish I got the plastic board instead
customer_reviews.text: Its entertaining for a minute, but not as fun as the plastic board where you twist.
customer_reviews.author: Earth

customer_reviews.title: A fun fitness tool for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8year old who is a flyer for comp cheer, to work on her stability in stunts. The whole family likes to play with it, we challenge each other to try different movements, even guests come over and play with it. It’s a fun piece of equipment for mobility and stability!
customer_reviews.author: L. P. Bonner

customer_reviews.title: Great price and portable.
customer_reviews.text: The BOSU Ball like at the gym would be about $130 and wouldn't be nearly as portable. This is an amazing price for practicing my balance, and I can take it with me. I'm 68-years-old and the mandatory retirement age at work is when I fall down. This will keep me employed for years.
customer_reviews.author: Chas M Keeys

customer_reviews.title: Maybe More Than you Want
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the long type of balance boards - those are easy to balance compared to this model. You will definitely feel it in your legs after twenty minutes on this balance. I use it at my stand-up desk although it requires a bit more concentration to stay balanced than the alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis LaPierre

customer_reviews.title: Good value but kinda weird
customer_reviews.text: Balance isn't my strongest. Hoped this would help but it's super awkward. Seems a little small to me as well, especially for my husband's big feet.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Williams

customer_reviews.title: Be careful on hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to use this board. I put it on the hardwood floor in my apartment and, within 45 seconds of standing on it, I fell off of it. I broke a bone in my hand and returned this. Once I’m done with casts, splints, and hand therapy, I will be looking for something else. I don’t recommend it for hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Appearance Sub-Par (Returned)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my husband's birthday, and when it arrived, I noticed there was debris under the sticky label (like, a bug or a piece of dust or something). It probably worked great, but it was right in the center and very noticeable, so I didn't feel comfortable gifting.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: This has been my favorite Pandemic Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Other then splurging on a standing desk, this has been the most useful pandemic purchase. I bought it to use with my standing desk as sometimes I want to do more than just stand! This board is sturdy. Extremely high-quality and very reasonably priced. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Muhlyssa

customer_reviews.title: We use it every day.
customer_reviews.text: I use it mostly for my son. He is 7 y.o. So he stands on it and does his math: addition, subtraction, skip counting. It is very interesting that his counting ability is better now than his farther. Yes, we did not buy it for sport purpose. We bought it to develop brain. And it works great!.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Not good for practicing balance.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to practice my balance, but it is dangerous to use for that purpose. When I showed it to my PT, she said to return it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Bobo

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and decently challenging
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and decently challenging balance board (for a 195 lbs adult). I've never had the greatest balance so I bought this as a way to passively improve my balance and strengthen core muscles, etc. I mostly use it while watching netflix or TV at home and just balance on the board while watching instead of sitting. I started off terrible but improved pretty quickly. I can now balance on it for about and hour before my feet get sore. Once I master this one, I'm planning to move up to one of those rolling balance boards since standing still does get a little monotonous over time
customer_reviews.author: Alex T

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product is not meant to be stable. So, my stability rating is based on how perfectly unstable it is. I have good balance/coordination and it took about a week of use at my desk to be able to balance on it without thinking about it. I enjoy trying to do squats and other exercises on it. It also is nice way to maintain a bit of fitness when you have to be at a desk all day. Very well made I have used it daily for a few months now without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Bell

customer_reviews.title: huge base,  very easy to balance on
customer_reviews.text: If you are getting this balance board as your first balance board and you have never used a board before this is a good one, if you have decent balance and you want something a little more challenging, then get something else, this one is too easy to balance on
customer_reviews.author: Bondy3

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great requires you to balance on all sides not just front/back or left/right. Made of thick sturdy wood. You will need to use it on carpet or at least a bath matt. Does not work well on wood or tile floors.
customer_reviews.author: James Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Balance Board, Cost Effecient
customer_reviews.text: For $21 this is a great balance board. I am using it now at my standing desk. You can play with it for various exercise techniques similar to a Bosu ball, not all of course. Space saving and money saving, this is a nice little addition to working your core muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great low impact muscle toner for lower legs and balance improver
customer_reviews.text: Great low impact muscle toner for lower legs and balance improver - do this while watching tv and you'll be on a tight rope in no time. For greater impact do it while playing video games which is quite a mental bender and adds more challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Moose the Moose

customer_reviews.title: It is lumpy - not like others
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy, but... The ball doesn't roll smooth at bottom, instead it's notchy so it reduces the challenge and not smooth. I thought all wobble boards are the same, but they are not.
customer_reviews.author: S. Woo

customer_reviews.title: Good Wobbleboard for the Price
customer_reviews.text: A good quality wobbleboard for anyone needing to do physio exercises or balance exercises. The one issue I have with it is that you cannot adjust the setting so you only have a more advanced setting to work with. Therefore, novices beware!
customer_reviews.author: mini

customer_reviews.title: It’s too tricky to workout on
customer_reviews.text: It’s overall small size and slippery “balance” sphere on the bottom, make it super tricky to get on and to balance.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful exercise tool!
customer_reviews.text: It's great to stand on and improve core strength and balance. Just had pelvic surgery so I'm looking for small exercises to slowly rehab back to more intense core exercises. This has been really helpful so far, looking forward to adding in some more exercises on the board.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice balance/wobble board
customer_reviews.text: This wobble board was bought to use with my dog to train balance. However, my husband have, both, been on it working on our balance. It is sturdy and the perfect height for all of us.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Fun to play with
customer_reviews.text: Way harder than you would think to stay balanced mainly b/c of the user lol. Once you get the hang of it it’s great however I don’t see me being able to use it while cooking like I thought I would be able to my fault their I believe
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Five stars but very challenging!
customer_reviews.text: This wobble board is made very well and looks nicer than I thought it would, but I have to say it is a bit more challenging than I expected. Be VERY careful esp the first time you go to use this!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex :-)

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: I have a hydraulic desk at work so I have the option to stand or sit. The wobble board keeps me active and engaged and allows me to use my standing desk for longer periods of time without getting bored. My coworkers love to borrow it too.
customer_reviews.author: The Strick-Man

customer_reviews.title: Great value and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The board itself is very sturdy and comes out of the box ready to go. It also is cheaper than most of the competition. I have been using it for a few weeks now to rehab and ankle injury and improve my overall stability and it has worked wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Axel Croy

customer_reviews.title: Functional and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I’m aging and need to work on my balance and strengthen my calf muscles. I feel using this has helped me increase balance and strengthen my calf which has been weak since an injury
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic PT gear
customer_reviews.text: Recovery hasn't always been my strong suit so I tend to let running injuries pile up. I've been incorporating 5-10 minutes throughout the day and my ankles and knees haven't felt this good in years. If I'm really paying attention, I'll get a few minutes on the wobble board before any run.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck McAllister

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious balance board! The ball on the bottom is smaller than I have used at the gym. Unless you have used balance boards regularly in the past, you might want to hang on to something when you first start using it. After I got used to it, it is really good!
customer_reviews.author: Avalanche

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: Good tool for older people like me. It's unstable, but that's the idea to train your balance reflexes. The one-star for stability should really be a 5-star for utility. Sturdy. You won't break it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I have a standup desk at work and wouldn't know what to do without one of these. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley McKe

customer_reviews.title: Really fun! Good workout
customer_reviews.text: Really fun to use, sturdy. Good for working out or just playing around. Has a good grip so you won't slip off, just don't use barefooted because the top is like sandpaper
customer_reviews.author: K Grasher

customer_reviews.title: Impressed about quality for price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to start practicing with but unwilling to pay the $100 for the classic models that I was thinking of, especially since I didn't even know if I would like it that much and use it enough to get my moneys worth. It is much more sturdy than you would have thought for that great price but it functions just as well. I would recommend it for a beginner like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Fun & sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My whole family wants one! This is solid and well made. We are not small people and all of us have used it. It also stretches the muscles nicely. Who knew! This was a whimsical gift that has turned out to be a big hit!
customer_reviews.author: MKD

customer_reviews.title: Bought for the classroom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my classroom and I find myself using it. It is great for the child that likes to stand and move while working. The children love to strengthen their core and focus on their work.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love my wobble board and the price was great. Works great for coordination, core, and ankle strength. Got this one as a recommendaton from my therapist while restrengthening my achilles tendon
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Gore

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what it looks like
customer_reviews.text: We keep it by the TV and it's great alternative to get up and stand on this during a TV show or two instead of slouching on the couch. Good quality. Wood edges are a bit sharp, 5 minutes with some sandpaper is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Brownell

customer_reviews.title: Well-made product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to work on my balance as I get older. The balance board did not disappoint. It was very well constructed and sturdy. Very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: MareBear75

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: After looking at these for a while at the athletic stores, and realizing I wasn’t gonna spend $40 on one. I checked out amazon and came across this AmazonBasics balance board and grabbed it!! I love it super sturdy and love the grips on the top of the board so I feel super secure on it!!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney T

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value, perfect for every age
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Not too crazy, so you don’t have to worry about breaking your neck if you fall. Is great for the 6 year old all the way to the 60 year old. My 6 year old son uses it to do stick work for hockey and I use it to do squats on. Awesome value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs S

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! It’s cheaper than other brands and it does exactly what I expected it to. I like to balance on it while I’m watching tv to get a little extra movement in my day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our home for stability workouts. Definitely consider buying it if you’d like to develop a higher performance in a sport. Balance and core work it vital
customer_reviews.author: ASKeller

customer_reviews.title: great quality for very low cost
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this at my standing desk for well over a month now. I'm amazed at the quality, especially considering that competitors are $60-$200. Very sturdy and the top is covered in skateboard grip. If you're looking for a balance board, buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Russ W.

customer_reviews.title: perfectly fine
customer_reviews.text: Tried another brand at a friend's house. Went on amazon and this was recommended. Basically the same thing - no complaints. Hard to mess this up.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The center piece on the bottom is not fully rounded, it is more like a column with rounded edges. Not enough range of motion for my ankle rehab.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela S Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, basice balance/wobble board. Perfect for standing desk at work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my standing desk at work. It's perfect. Not too difficult to balance (I also have a true "balance board" to use for fitness/surf/skate etc.). Just enough to keep my core activated while focusing on the task(s) at hand.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A. Roemer

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Budget Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as recommended by a PT. More sturdy than expected, definitely works. Muscles were sore after about ten minutes of therapy exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey A

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This wobble board is an excellent buy for the money. It's no-frills (unstained wood finish), but that' just fine with me. It's helping me strengthen my core so as to alleviate severe lower back pain that I experience every so often.
customer_reviews.author: DV

customer_reviews.title: Nice Wobble Board
customer_reviews.text: Nice balance board. Use at a standing desk to get a little more movement during the work day. Definitely recommend for balance, workouts, and general usage.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Smith

customer_reviews.title: Slippery
customer_reviews.text: The product slips and moves around on the floor too much. Not safe in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Czelowalnik

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not worth keeping
customer_reviews.text: Returned this item, not enough wobble to be worth it and the bottom plastic part is not completely smooth and almost has a tip to it so that it doesn’t go completely centered.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy L

customer_reviews.title: Nice gear!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and our 3year old daughter love it. He said it helps stretching part of his legs and feet that's normally hard to do. I haven't tried it yet as I was heavily pregnant but would like to use it sometime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Hans C Adams

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and perfect !
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase !! Sturdy and perfect for balance training ! A kind of sand paper on top for traction. 5 stars !!
customer_reviews.author: aurora432

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this every day and it's a great for my balance. It's also pretty entertaining, everyone wants to try it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jordan Bickel

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: It's harder to balance than I thought it would be. Awesome little work out tool. After 15mins I felt it in my core and calves.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Small and needs sanded on edges
customer_reviews.text: Small and edges are not sanded so it can cut you. I sanded mine smooth and it's better but at 6'2" with broad shoulders, even holding the sides is basically a close grip pushup position.
customer_reviews.author: Blueridge_Marc

customer_reviews.title: Product does as needed
customer_reviews.text: Stability you ask? Overall the item does what I needed it to do. Very sturdy and made from solid wood. So far it’s been a huge help in my ACL rehab.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Restrepo

customer_reviews.title: simple, and great
customer_reviews.text: does what it's meant to. good, simple, sturdy. I've exercised with it almost every day since I got it, and brought it on road trips with me where I was going places with no gym access. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Strengthen your core.
customer_reviews.text: Used one of these during rehab for a hip injury. Bought my own and use it daily. Small price to pay for improved balance.
customer_reviews.author: Roger B. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, improved balance quick
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this recently while watching tv or playing video games. I found it pretty easy to stand on from the start. After a few days I've noticed that I don't have to concentrate as much while standing on the board, a sign that my balance is improving. I'm considering purchasing more for my parents so they can also work on their balance (it's that easy & effective).
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Estes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to work on balance. I am overweight and wanting to improve my overall health. I like to stand on it while watching TV.
customer_reviews.author: charlie elliott

customer_reviews.title: Balance
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money - it’s basic and that’s all I need. Hard for me to balance in one leg and that’s the exercise
customer_reviews.author: Nettie Goins

customer_reviews.title: Balance is so important
customer_reviews.text: I love my board and keep it just in front of the TV so I can always just balance, while on the phone, watching a show or even a quick walk through the room. Balance is super important for your overall health and well-being.
customer_reviews.author: klm

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is well built and just the right size. I use it at my stand up desk to help engage my core and other muscles while typing. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping.. it’s super sturdy.. and is helping me greatly with balance issues I’ve had from chronic vertigo
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: Great price, works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I feel like my balance has gotten markedly better since I have been using it. Hard to beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good balance tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun addition if you have a partner willing to play - we try to see who can last longer. Nice duels, sturdy and fun
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Good devide
customer_reviews.text: Works well, I use it every day and am noticing positive changes. Tends to be a little slippery on caroet
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo

customer_reviews.title: Slips alot and not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately had to return this item. I don't know how people are not commenting on how difficult it is to balance on. The wooden surface area is too small and the base it by design slipped regardless of the floor type, in most cases. Seemed like great value for money at first.
customer_reviews.author: Amzn buyer

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Love this great for balance work. My therapist recommened it and it works great. Sure helps me
customer_reviews.author: Anna Salini

customer_reviews.title: Not easy but worth ot
customer_reviews.text: I dislike how I no longer have great balance. This stability ball is difficult but so helpful
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought but well made product
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought. Cannot use for pushups or stability squats as it is too small. But it is a sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Moke

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I took it to work and use it every morning. my co-workers all want one
customer_reviews.author: Miller Wife

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Wood Wobble Exercise Balance Board
feature_bullets: Black balance board can help improve core strength, coordination, posture, and balance
Suitable for a wide range of exercises, including push-ups, plank, standing balance poses, and targeted workouts for strengthening specific muscles, ligaments, tendons, and joints
Solid wood top supports up to 265 pounds; non-slip surface for a secure grip
For individuals and athletes; ideal for a rehab center, gym, or home workout space
Measures 15.5 by 15.5 by 3.15 inches (LxWxH); backed by an AmazonBasics 1-year limited warranty
